comments:
The simple code:

final IContainer newClient = ContainerFactory.getDefault()
				.createContainer("ecf.xmpp.smack");
.
.
.
IPresenceContainerAdapter pc = (IPresenceContainerAdapter) newClient
				.getAdapter(IPresenceContainerAdapter.class);
.
.
.
pc.getChatRoomManager().createChatRoom(roomName, null);

Hi Cui,

Thanks for the report.

This looks to me like the room create failure message returned from the Wildfire server (e.g. if the user is not authorized to create rooms, or if the server is not configured to allow non-admin room creation).  Can you see if this is what you might be experiencing by checking the server configuration params?

I will also try out at ecf.eclipse.org and try to reproduce, but this may take a little while as I'm trying to get out a M6 release by 3.30.2007.

Hi Scott,
I use Jabberd2 on LinuxServer. I add MU-Conference on server then not exception.
Very Thanks.
